title: How does the amount spent on home care vary by client type?
analysis_commentary:
We can see that by far the largest amount spent on home care is for the over 65s, in 2012-13 it was just over £1.8 billion. This has however been decreasing since 2010-11, where it was at a high of £2.1 billion. The amount spent on home care for adults under 65 with learning disabilities has been increasing since 1994-95, reaching £0.7 billion in 2012-13. Spending for adults under 65 with physical disability or sensory impairment also generally increased to a high of £0.3 billion in 2010-11 and has decreased slightly in the following years. The amount spent for adults under 65 with mental health needs was the smallest, around £0.07 billion in 2012-13.

For further discussions on changes in social care expenditure see our Focus on: Social care for older people < http://www.qualitywatch.org.uk/focus-on/social-care-older-people>.
data_source: Health & social care information centre, Personal Social Services Expenditure and Unit Costs
